tasks.title: Setup Project Repository
tasks.description: Initialize a new Git repository and create the basic project structure for the calculator web application
tasks.details: Create a new directory 'basic-calculator', initialize Git with 'git init', create .gitignore file with common web development exclusions (node_modules/, .DS_Store, etc.), create README.md with project overview, and establish folder structure: /src for source files, /tests for test files, /assets for images/icons if needed
tasks.testStrategy: Verify repository is initialized correctly by checking .git folder exists, ensure .gitignore is properly configured, and confirm folder structure matches requirements

subtasks.title: Create project directory and initialize Git
subtasks.description: Create the 'basic-calculator' directory and initialize it as a Git repository
subtasks.details: Create a new directory named 'basic-calculator' using mkdir command, navigate into it with cd command, and run 'git init' to initialize the repository. Verify the .git folder is created successfully.

subtasks.title: Create and configure .gitignore file
subtasks.description: Create a .gitignore file with appropriate exclusions for web development
subtasks.details: Create .gitignore file in the root directory and add common exclusions: node_modules/, .DS_Store, *.log, dist/, .env, .vscode/, *.swp, *.swo, coverage/, and any other IDE-specific files. Ensure the file is properly formatted with one pattern per line.

subtasks.title: Create initial README.md with project structure
subtasks.description: Create README.md file with project overview and structure documentation
subtasks.details: Create README.md with: project title 'Basic Calculator Web Application', brief description, project structure outline, setup instructions placeholder, and sections for features, technologies used, and contribution guidelines. Use proper Markdown formatting.

subtasks.title: Set up folder structure for source, tests, and assets

subtasks.details: Create three main directories: /src for source files (HTML, CSS, JS), /tests for test files, and /assets for images/icons. tasks.title: Design Calculator Layout Grid

tasks.details: Add button elements inside buttons container: numbers 0-9, operators (+, -, *, /), equals (=), and clear (C). Total 16 buttons in 4x4 grid layout

subtasks.title: Create number buttons (0-9) with proper data attributes

subtasks.title: Add operator buttons (+, -, *, /)
subtasks.description: Create HTML button elements for all mathematical operators with proper classes and data attributes
subtasks.details: Create 4 button elements for operators: addition (+), subtraction (-), multiplication (*), and division (/). Each button should follow the pattern: <button class='btn operator' data-value='[operator]'>[operator]</button>. Position these in the rightmost column of the grid

subtasks.title: Add special buttons (equals, clear)

tasks.title: Create CSS File Structure
tasks.description: Set up the main CSS file with reset styles and CSS custom properties for theming

subtasks.title: Define CSS custom properties for colors and typography

Consider adding variations like --text-color-light, --bg-color-dark for different states

subtasks.title: Set up global styles and box-sizing
subtasks.description: Establish fundamental global styles including box-sizing and base typography
subtasks.details: Apply box-sizing: border-box to all elements using *, *::before, *::after selector. Set base font-size (16px or 1rem) and line-height (1.5-1.6) on body. Define default font-family using CSS variable. Set default text and background colors using defined variables

subtasks.title: Establish base layout utilities
subtasks.description: Create reusable utility classes for common layout patterns
subtasks.details: Create utility classes for: .container (max-width and centering), .flex (display: flex with common variations), .grid (basic grid setup), spacing utilities (.m-1, .p-1, etc. using --spacing-unit), .sr-only for screen reader text. Include responsive considerations where applicable

tasks.title: Style Calculator Container
tasks.description: Apply styling to the main calculator container for a modern, clean appearance
tasks.details: Style .calculator class: max-width: 400px, margin: 50px auto, padding: 20px, background: #f0f0f0, border-radius: 10px, box-shadow: 0 0 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.1). Center on page using flexbox on body element
tasks.testStrategy: Visual inspection to ensure calculator is centered, check computed styles match specifications, test on different screen sizes

subtasks.title: Set up body element flexbox styling
subtasks.description: Configure the body element to use flexbox for centering the calculator container on the page
subtasks.details: Add CSS rules to the body element: display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; min-height: 100vh; margin: 0; padding: 0; This will create a full viewport height container that centers its content both horizontally and vertically
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify body element has flexbox properties applied, check that calculator is centered both horizontally and vertically in the viewport, test on different screen sizes to ensure centering remains consistent

subtasks.title: Apply calculator container dimensions and spacing
subtasks.description: Set the width constraints and spacing properties for the .calculator class
subtasks.details: Add CSS rules to .calculator class: max-width: 400px; margin: 50px auto; padding: 20px; The max-width ensures the calculator doesn't exceed 400px on larger screens, margin provides spacing from viewport edges, and padding creates internal spacing for content
subtasks.testStrategy: Measure computed width to ensure it doesn't exceed 400px, verify 50px margin is applied on all sides, check that 20px padding is present inside the container

subtasks.title: Style calculator background and appearance
subtasks.description: Apply the background color and visual styling to make the calculator container visually appealing
subtasks.details: Add CSS rules to .calculator class: background: #f0f0f0; This light gray background provides a subtle, modern appearance that contrasts well with the page background and button elements
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify background color is exactly #f0f0f0 using browser developer tools, ensure color provides sufficient contrast with child elements

subtasks.title: Add border radius for rounded corners
subtasks.description: Apply border radius to create smooth, rounded corners on the calculator container
subtasks.details: Add CSS rule to .calculator class: border-radius: 10px; This creates uniformly rounded corners with a 10px radius, giving the calculator a modern, polished appearance
subtasks.testStrategy: Inspect computed styles to verify 10px border-radius is applied to all corners, visually confirm corners appear smoothly rounded without pixelation

subtasks.title: Apply box shadow for depth effect
subtasks.description: Add a subtle shadow to create visual depth and make the calculator appear elevated from the page
subtasks.details: Add CSS rule to .calculator class: box-shadow: 0 0 20px rgba(0,0,0,0.1); This creates a soft, diffused shadow with 20px blur radius and 10% opacity black color, providing a subtle depth effect without being too prominent
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify box-shadow property is correctly applied with all values, check shadow appearance in different lighting conditions, ensure shadow doesn't interfere with surrounding elements

tasks.title: Style Display Screen
tasks.description: Create styling for the calculator display screen that shows input and results
tasks.details: Style .display class: background: #333, color: white, font-size: 2em, padding: 10px, text-align: right, margin-bottom: 10px, min-height: 50px, border-radius: 5px, overflow: hidden, font-family: monospace for better number alignment
tasks.testStrategy: Verify display is visually distinct from buttons, check text alignment is correct, test with long numbers to ensure overflow handling

subtasks.title: Create Display Container Styles
subtasks.description: Apply the base styling to the .display class including background color, text color, and dimensions
subtasks.details: Add CSS rules to .display class: background-color: #333; color: white; min-height: 50px; margin-bottom: 10px; This creates the dark background container with white text and ensures minimum height for the display area.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the display has a dark gray (#333) background, white text color is applied, and the container maintains a minimum height of 50px even when empty

subtasks.title: Configure Display Typography
subtasks.description: Set up the font properties for optimal number display including size, family, and alignment
subtasks.details: Add typography rules to .display class: font-size: 2em; font-family: 'Courier New', Courier, monospace; text-align: right; The monospace font ensures consistent digit width and right alignment positions numbers correctly for calculator display.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test that numbers align properly to the right, verify monospace font renders all digits with equal width, check font size scales appropriately with different viewport sizes

subtasks.title: Add Display Padding and Spacing
subtasks.description: Implement internal padding for proper content spacing within the display area
subtasks.details: Add padding rule to .display class: padding: 10px; This creates consistent spacing between the display content and its borders, ensuring numbers don't touch the edges of the container.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify 10px padding is applied on all sides, check that long numbers maintain proper spacing from edges, ensure padding doesn't cause layout shifts

subtasks.title: Style Display Border and Corners
subtasks.description: Apply rounded corners to soften the display appearance and match modern UI design
subtasks.details: Add border styling to .display class: border-radius: 5px; This creates subtle rounded corners that make the display visually appealing and consistent with modern calculator designs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Confirm 5px border radius is applied to all corners, verify corners render smoothly without pixelation, check that border radius doesn't interfere with text display

subtasks.title: Implement Overflow Handling
subtasks.description: Configure overflow behavior to handle long numbers or expressions that exceed display width
subtasks.details: Add overflow rule to .display class: overflow: hidden; This prevents content from spilling outside the display container when numbers are too long, maintaining a clean appearance while ensuring all content stays within bounds.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with very long numbers to verify they don't overflow outside container, check that overflow hidden doesn't cut off content unexpectedly, verify horizontal scrolling is disabled

tasks.title: Implement Button Grid Layout
tasks.description: Use CSS Grid to create a 4x4 button layout for the calculator
tasks.details: Style .buttons container: display: grid, grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr), gap: 10px. This creates equal-width columns with consistent spacing between buttons
tasks.testStrategy: Verify buttons are arranged in 4x4 grid, check spacing is consistent, ensure grid is responsive

subtasks.title: Create Basic Grid Container Structure
subtasks.description: Set up the .buttons container element with CSS Grid display property and define the basic grid structure
subtasks.details: Add CSS rule for .buttons container: display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr); This establishes the grid context and creates 4 equal-width columns that will automatically adjust to the container width
subtasks.testStrategy: Inspect element to verify grid display is applied and 4 columns are created with equal widths

subtasks.title: Add Grid Gap Spacing
subtasks.description: Implement consistent spacing between grid items using the gap property
subtasks.details: Update .buttons CSS to include: gap: 10px; This creates uniform 10px spacing between all buttons both horizontally and vertically, replacing the need for individual margins
subtasks.testStrategy: Measure spacing between buttons to confirm 10px gap, verify no double margins at edges

subtasks.title: Configure Grid Auto-Flow and Alignment
subtasks.description: Set grid auto-flow behavior and ensure proper alignment of grid items
subtasks.details: Add to .buttons CSS: grid-auto-flow: row; align-items: stretch; justify-items: stretch; This ensures buttons fill from left to right, row by row, and stretch to fill their grid cells completely
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify buttons flow left-to-right in rows, check that buttons expand to fill grid cells

subtasks.title: Handle Special Button Spans
subtasks.description: Implement CSS for buttons that need to span multiple grid cells (like equals or zero button)
subtasks.details: Add CSS classes for special buttons: .button-wide { grid-column: span 2; } for buttons that should take up 2 columns. Apply to zero button or equals button as needed in the layout
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify wide buttons span exactly 2 columns, ensure grid layout remains intact with spanning elements

subtasks.title: Add Responsive Grid Adjustments
subtasks.description: Ensure the grid layout remains functional and visually appealing on different screen sizes
subtasks.details: Add media query for smaller screens: @media (max-width: 400px) { .buttons { gap: 5px; } } This reduces spacing on small screens. Also ensure grid container has appropriate max-width and padding for optimal display
subtasks.testStrategy: Test layout on various screen sizes, verify buttons remain clickable and properly spaced on mobile devices

tasks.title: Style Calculator Buttons
tasks.description: Apply consistent styling to all calculator buttons with hover and active states
tasks.details: Style .btn class: padding: 20px, font-size: 1.2em, border: none, border-radius: 5px, cursor: pointer, background: #e0e0e0, transition: all 0.2s. Add hover state: background: #d0d0d0, transform: translateY(-2px). Add active state: transform: translateY(0)
tasks.testStrategy: Test all button states (normal, hover, active), verify transitions are smooth, check cursor changes on hover

subtasks.title: Define Base Button Styles
subtasks.description: Create the foundational CSS rules for the .btn class with basic styling properties
subtasks.details: In the CSS file, add the .btn class selector and define these properties: padding: 20px; font-size: 1.2em; border: none; border-radius: 5px; cursor: pointer; background: #e0e0e0; transition: all 0.2s; This establishes the default appearance for all calculator buttons with smooth transition effects.
subtasks.testStrategy: Inspect a button element in browser dev tools to verify all base styles are applied correctly, check that cursor changes to pointer on hover

subtasks.title: Implement Button Hover State
subtasks.description: Add CSS rules for button hover effects including background color change and upward translation
subtasks.details: Create the .btn:hover selector and add: background: #d0d0d0; transform: translateY(-2px); This creates a subtle lift effect when users hover over buttons, providing visual feedback. The darker background color (#d0d0d0) creates contrast from the default state.
subtasks.testStrategy: Hover over each button type and verify the background color changes to #d0d0d0 and the button moves up 2 pixels smoothly

subtasks.title: Add Button Active State
subtasks.description: Define CSS rules for the active (pressed) state to provide tactile feedback
subtasks.details: Add the .btn:active selector with: transform: translateY(0); This resets the vertical position when a button is clicked, creating a press-down effect. Combined with the transition property from the base styles, this creates smooth button press animation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Click and hold each button to verify it returns to original position (translateY(0)), ensure the transition is smooth and responsive

subtasks.title: Style Special Button Types
subtasks.description: Apply distinct styling to operator, equals, and clear buttons for better visual hierarchy
subtasks.details: Add specific styles for button types: .btn.operator { background: #ff9500; color: white; } .btn.operator:hover { background: #e08600; } .btn.equals { background: #4CAF50; color: white; } .btn.equals:hover { background: #45a049; } .btn.clear { background: #f44336; color: white; } .btn.clear:hover { background: #da190b; }
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify each button type has its distinct color, check hover states work correctly for special buttons, ensure text is readable with white color on colored backgrounds

subtasks.title: Ensure Cross-Browser Compatibility
subtasks.description: Add vendor prefixes and fallbacks to ensure consistent button styling across different browsers
subtasks.details: Add vendor prefixes for transform property: -webkit-transform for Safari/Chrome, -moz-transform for Firefox, -ms-transform for IE. Also add box-sizing: border-box to .btn class to ensure consistent sizing. Consider adding -webkit-appearance: none to remove default button styling on iOS devices.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test button appearance and interactions in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge browsers, verify transitions work smoothly in all browsers

tasks.title: Differentiate Button Types Visually
tasks.description: Apply distinct styling to number buttons, operator buttons, equals, and clear buttons
tasks.details: Style .btn.number: background: #fff. Style .btn.operator: background: #ff9800, color: white. Style .btn.equals: background: #4caf50, color: white, grid-column: span 2. Style .btn.clear: background: #f44336, color: white, grid-column: span 2
tasks.testStrategy: Visually verify each button type has distinct appearance, check color contrast meets accessibility standards

subtasks.title: Style Number Buttons
subtasks.description: Apply white background styling to all number buttons (0-9) to make them visually distinct
subtasks.details: Add CSS rule for .btn.number class: background-color: #fff; color: #333; border: 1px solid #ddd; transition: background-color 0.2s ease. This creates clean white buttons with dark text for optimal readability
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify all number buttons (0-9) have white background, check text contrast ratio meets WCAG AA standards (4.5:1), test hover states work correctly

subtasks.title: Style Operator Buttons
subtasks.description: Apply orange background with white text to operator buttons (+, -, *, /) for clear visual differentiation
subtasks.details: Add CSS rule for .btn.operator class: background-color: #ff9800; color: white; border: none; font-weight: bold; transition: background-color 0.2s ease. Add hover state with darker orange (#f57c00) for better user feedback
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify all operator buttons have orange background, ensure white text is clearly visible, test color contrast meets WCAG standards, check hover effects work

subtasks.title: Style Equals Button
subtasks.description: Apply green background styling to equals button and make it span two grid columns for prominence
subtasks.details: Add CSS rule for .btn.equals class: background-color: #4caf50; color: white; grid-column: span 2; border: none; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.2em; transition: background-color 0.2s ease. Add hover state with darker green (#388e3c)
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify equals button has green background and spans 2 columns, check button alignment in grid, test that spanning doesn't break layout on different screen sizes

subtasks.title: Style Clear Button
subtasks.description: Apply red background styling to clear button and make it span two grid columns for easy access
subtasks.details: Add CSS rule for .btn.clear class: background-color: #f44336; color: white; grid-column: span 2; border: none; font-weight: bold; transition: background-color 0.2s ease. Add hover state with darker red (#d32f2f) for visual feedback
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify clear button has red background and spans 2 columns, ensure button is easily distinguishable as a destructive action, test grid layout remains intact

subtasks.title: Add Button Active States and Transitions
subtasks.description: Implement active states and smooth transitions for all button types to enhance user interaction feedback
subtasks.details: Add general button transitions and active states: .btn { cursor: pointer; transition: all 0.2s ease; } .btn:active { transform: scale(0.95); } .btn.number:hover { background-color: #f5f5f5; } .btn:focus { outline: 2px solid #2196f3; outline-offset: 2px; } for accessibility
subtasks.testStrategy: Test all button types have smooth hover transitions, verify active state provides tactile feedback, ensure focus states are visible for keyboard navigation

tasks.title: Create JavaScript File Structure
tasks.description: Set up the main JavaScript file with initial structure and strict mode
tasks.details: Create script.js, add 'use strict' directive, create main calculator object or class structure. Initial structure: const calculator = { displayValue: '0', firstOperand: null, waitingForOperand: false, operator: null }
tasks.testStrategy: Verify JavaScript file loads without errors, check strict mode is enabled, confirm initial object structure is created

subtasks.title: Create script.js with strict mode and basic structure
subtasks.description: Create the main JavaScript file with proper strict mode declaration and basic file structure including comments and initial setup
subtasks.details: Create script.js file in project root. Add 'use strict'; at the top. Include file header comment with description, author, and date. Set up basic IIFE (Immediately Invoked Function Expression) pattern to avoid global scope pollution: (function() { 'use strict'; // Calculator code here })();

subtasks.title: Define calculator state object with initial values
subtasks.description: Create the main calculator object with all necessary properties to track calculator state and initial default values
subtasks.details: Inside the IIFE, define const calculator = { displayValue: '0', firstOperand: null, waitingForOperand: false, operator: null, memory: 0 }; Add comments explaining each property's purpose. Ensure object is properly structured for future method additions

subtasks.title: Set up basic initialization and DOM ready handling
subtasks.description: Implement DOM content loaded event listener and basic initialization function to ensure code runs after HTML is fully loaded
subtasks.details: Add document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', init); Create init() function that will contain all initialization logic. Add console.log to verify script loads successfully. Set up basic error handling with try-catch block in init function

tasks.title: Implement Display Update Function
tasks.description: Create a function to update the calculator display with current value
tasks.details: Create updateDisplay() function: const display = document.querySelector('.display'); display.textContent = calculator.displayValue; Call this function on page load to show initial '0'
tasks.testStrategy: Verify display shows '0' on page load, test updating displayValue and calling updateDisplay() shows new value

subtasks.title: Create updateDisplay Function
subtasks.description: Implement the core updateDisplay() function that retrieves the display element and updates its content with the current calculator display value
subtasks.testStrategy: Create unit test to verify function correctly updates DOM element with calculator.displayValue, test with various values including '0', negative numbers, and decimals

subtasks.title: Initialize Display on Page Load
subtasks.description: Set up event listener for DOMContentLoaded to call updateDisplay() when the page loads, ensuring the display shows the initial '0' value
subtasks.testStrategy: Test that display shows '0' immediately after page load, verify DOMContentLoaded event properly triggers updateDisplay()

subtasks.title: Add Error Handling to updateDisplay
subtasks.description: Enhance updateDisplay() function with error handling to gracefully handle cases where the display element is not found or displayValue is invalid
subtasks.testStrategy: Test function behavior when display element is missing, test with null/undefined displayValue, verify appropriate fallback to '0'

subtasks.title: Integrate Display Length Validation
subtasks.description: Add validation to updateDisplay() to handle display overflow by limiting the number of characters shown on the display
subtasks.testStrategy: Test with strings longer than 12 characters, verify truncation works correctly, ensure decimal points and negative signs are handled properly in character count

tasks.title: Add Event Listeners to Buttons
tasks.description: Set up click event listeners for all calculator buttons
tasks.details: Use event delegation on buttons container: document.querySelector('.buttons').addEventListener('click', (event) => { if (!event.target.matches('button')) return; // Handle button click based on class }). This is more efficient than individual listeners
tasks.testStrategy: Click each button and verify event is captured, check that non-button clicks are ignored, test event.target properties

subtasks.title: Set up event delegation on button container
subtasks.description: Implement event delegation by attaching a single click event listener to the buttons container element
subtasks.details: Add event listener to .buttons container using document.querySelector('.buttons').addEventListener('click', handleButtonClick). This approach is more efficient than adding individual listeners to each button and automatically handles dynamically added buttons

subtasks.title: Create button click handler with type detection
subtasks.description: Implement the main event handler function that detects button types and extracts relevant data
subtasks.details: Create handleButtonClick function that: 1) Checks if clicked element is a button using event.target.matches('button'), 2) Extracts button type from classes (number, operator, equals, clear), 3) Gets button value from textContent or data attributes, 4) Prevents handling of non-button clicks

subtasks.title: Route clicks to appropriate handler functions
subtasks.description: Implement routing logic to call specific handler functions based on button type
subtasks.details: Inside handleButtonClick, use switch statement or if-else chain to route to appropriate handlers: handleNumberClick() for numbers, handleOperatorClick() for operators, handleEqualsClick() for equals, handleClearClick() for clear. Pass relevant data (button value, event) to each handler

tasks.title: Handle Number Button Clicks
tasks.description: Implement logic to handle number input (0-9) and update display
tasks.details: Create inputDigit(digit) function: if (calculator.waitingForOperand) { calculator.displayValue = digit; calculator.waitingForOperand = false; } else { calculator.displayValue = calculator.displayValue === '0' ? digit : calculator.displayValue + digit; } updateDisplay();
tasks.testStrategy: Test entering single digit replaces initial 0, test multiple digits concatenate, verify leading zeros are handled correctly

subtasks.title: Create inputDigit function with basic concatenation
subtasks.description: Implement the core inputDigit(digit) function that handles basic number concatenation when adding digits to the display
subtasks.details: Create function inputDigit(digit) that concatenates the digit parameter to calculator.displayValue. Initially implement simple concatenation logic: calculator.displayValue = calculator.displayValue + digit. This establishes the basic function structure before adding state handling

subtasks.title: Handle waiting for operand state
subtasks.description: Add logic to handle the waitingForOperand state when a new number should replace the current display value
subtasks.details: Modify inputDigit function to check if (calculator.waitingForOperand). When true, set calculator.displayValue = digit and calculator.waitingForOperand = false to replace the display with the new digit. When false, use the concatenation logic from subtask 13.1

subtasks.title: Implement proper handling of leading zeros and display updates
subtasks.description: Add logic to prevent multiple leading zeros and ensure display updates after each digit input
subtasks.details: Update the concatenation logic to check if calculator.displayValue === '0'. If true, replace with the new digit instead of concatenating. This prevents '00123' scenarios. Add updateDisplay() call at the end of inputDigit function to refresh the display element with the new value

tasks.title: Implement Clear Functionality
tasks.description: Create function to clear calculator state and reset display
tasks.details: Create clear() function: calculator.displayValue = '0'; calculator.firstOperand = null; calculator.waitingForOperand = false; calculator.operator = null; updateDisplay();
tasks.testStrategy: Test clear button resets display to 0, verify all calculator properties are reset, test clear during various calculation states

subtasks.title: Define Calculator State Structure

subtasks.details: Add deployment section to README.md with: build command usage, deployment steps, environment requirements, common issues and solutions. Include example commands and expected output. Document rollback procedure if needed

tasks.title: Perform Security Audit
tasks.description: Review code for security vulnerabilities
tasks.details: Check for: XSS vulnerabilities (sanitize any user input), ensure no eval() usage, verify HTTPS usage in production, add Content Security Policy headers if needed
tasks.testStrategy: Run security scanning tools, attempt XSS attacks, verify CSP headers work correctly

subtasks.title: Scan for XSS vulnerabilities
subtasks.description: Perform comprehensive XSS vulnerability scanning across all user input points and display outputs
subtasks.details: Review all places where user input is accepted (calculator display, button clicks). Check for proper input sanitization. Verify innerHTML usage is safe. Test with malicious input patterns like <script>alert('XSS')</script>. Use automated XSS scanning tools if available

subtasks.title: Review code for security best practices
subtasks.description: Audit JavaScript code for common security issues and best practices compliance
subtasks.details: Check for eval() or Function() constructor usage. Verify no dynamic code execution. Review event handlers for security. Ensure proper input validation. Check for exposed sensitive data. Verify HTTPS usage in production environment. Review third-party dependencies for known vulnerabilities

subtasks.title: Implement security headers
subtasks.description: Add Content Security Policy and other security headers to enhance application security
subtasks.details: Implement Content-Security-Policy header to prevent XSS attacks. Add X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff. Include X-Frame-Options: DENY to prevent clickjacking. Set Referrer-Policy for privacy. Test headers using browser developer tools and online security header analyzers

tasks.title: Add Performance Monitoring
tasks.description: Implement basic performance metrics tracking
tasks.details: Add performance marks for key operations: page load, first interaction, calculation time. Log to console in development. Consider integrating with analytics service for production
tasks.testStrategy: Verify performance marks are recorded, check timing data is accurate, ensure no performance impact

subtasks.title: Add performance marks for key operations
subtasks.description: Instrument the code with performance marks to measure page load, first interaction, and calculation time
subtasks.details: Use Performance API to add marks: performance.mark('page-load-start') at DOM ready, performance.mark('first-interaction') on first button click, performance.mark('calculation-start') and performance.mark('calculation-end') around evaluate() function. Use performance.measure() to calculate durations between marks

subtasks.title: Create performance logging system
subtasks.description: Implement a logging system to capture and display performance metrics in development mode
subtasks.details: Create a performanceLogger object with methods to log timing data. In development mode, use console.table() to display metrics. Include: page load time, time to first interaction, average calculation time, and number of calculations performed. Store metrics in localStorage for session analysis

subtasks.title: Consider analytics integration for production
subtasks.description: Plan and implement optional analytics service integration for production performance monitoring
subtasks.details: Research lightweight analytics options (Google Analytics, Simple Analytics, or custom solution). Create abstraction layer for analytics calls. Send custom events for: page load performance, calculation frequency, error rates. Ensure analytics code is conditionally loaded only in production environment

tasks.title: Create User Testing Plan
tasks.description: Develop plan for user acceptance testing
tasks.details: Create test scenarios for real users: basic calculations, complex operations, error cases. Prepare feedback form. Identify 5-10 test users. Document common issues found
tasks.testStrategy: Conduct user tests with diverse group, collect feedback systematically, prioritize issues found

subtasks.title: Define Test Scenarios and Tasks
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive test scenarios covering all calculator functionality including basic operations, complex calculations, edge cases, and error handling
subtasks.details: Develop test scenarios for: basic arithmetic (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division), decimal operations, percentage calculations, clear/reset functions, keyboard input, consecutive operations, division by zero, overflow handling, negative numbers, and memory functions if applicable. Create step-by-step test tasks with expected outcomes for each scenario

subtasks.title: Create Feedback Collection Forms
subtasks.description: Design and implement structured feedback forms to systematically collect user testing data, observations, and improvement suggestions
subtasks.details: Create forms including: pre-test questionnaire (user demographics, calculator usage experience), task completion checklist, usability rating scales (1-5 for ease of use, clarity, responsiveness), open-ended feedback sections for issues encountered, feature requests, and general comments. Include sections for observer notes and time-on-task measurements

subtasks.title: Recruit Diverse Test Users
subtasks.description: Identify and recruit 5-10 test users with varying technical backgrounds, ages, and calculator usage patterns to ensure comprehensive testing coverage
subtasks.details: Target user profiles: novice computer users, experienced calculator users, mobile device users, keyboard-heavy users, accessibility needs users. Create recruitment criteria, send invitations with testing schedule options, confirm participation and collect basic demographic information. Ensure mix of technical and non-technical users

subtasks.title: Prepare Testing Environment and Materials
subtasks.description: Set up controlled testing environment with necessary equipment, materials, and documentation to ensure consistent and effective user testing sessions
subtasks.details: Prepare testing setup: multiple devices (desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile), different browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge), screen recording software, printed test scenarios and forms, consent forms for recording, quiet testing space. Create testing protocol document with introduction script, task instructions, and debrief questions. Prepare backup calculator instance

tasks.title: Implement Feedback Changes
tasks.description: Address issues discovered during user testing
tasks.details: Review user feedback, prioritize changes by impact and effort. Common issues might include: button size on mobile, unclear error messages, missing features. Implement high-priority fixes
tasks.testStrategy: Verify each reported issue is addressed, re-test with users if possible, ensure no regressions

subtasks.title: Analyze and Categorize User Feedback
subtasks.description: Review all user feedback from testing sessions and organize it into categories such as UI/UX issues, functionality bugs, missing features, and performance concerns
subtasks.details: Create a feedback tracking document with columns for: issue description, category (UI/UX, functionality, feature request, performance), severity (critical, high, medium, low), affected component, and user count. Review all feedback and populate the tracking document systematically

subtasks.title: Prioritize Issues by Impact and Effort
subtasks.description: Evaluate each categorized issue based on user impact and implementation effort to create a prioritized fix list
subtasks.details: Use an impact/effort matrix to score each issue. Impact factors: number of users affected, severity of issue, business value. Effort factors: code complexity, testing requirements, potential for regression. Create ordered list with high-impact/low-effort items first

subtasks.title: Implement High-Priority Fixes
subtasks.description: Code and test solutions for the top-priority issues identified in the prioritization phase
subtasks.details: Start with top 5-10 issues from priority list. For each fix: create a branch, implement solution, test thoroughly including edge cases, ensure no regressions in existing functionality. Common fixes might include: adjusting button sizes for mobile, clarifying error messages, fixing calculation bugs

subtasks.title: Verify Fixes Address Reported Issues
subtasks.description: Validate that implemented fixes successfully resolve the original user-reported problems without introducing new issues
subtasks.details: For each implemented fix: reproduce the original issue to confirm it existed, apply the fix and verify issue is resolved, test related functionality for regressions, document the fix and testing results. If possible, have original reporters verify the fixes meet their needs

tasks.title: Final Testing and QA
tasks.description: Perform comprehensive final testing before deployment
tasks.details: Run through complete test suite: unit tests, browser compatibility, responsive design, accessibility, performance. Create final test report. Fix any critical issues found
tasks.testStrategy: Execute all test plans, document results, achieve 100% pass rate for critical functionality

subtasks.title: Execute Complete Unit Test Suite
subtasks.description: Run all unit tests for calculator functionality including basic operations, edge cases, and error handling
subtasks.details: Execute full test suite covering: arithmetic operations (+, -, *, /), decimal calculations, negative numbers, division by zero, maximum input length, clear functionality, consecutive operations. Document test results with pass/fail status for each test case. Ensure 100% pass rate for critical functionality

subtasks.title: Perform Browser Compatibility Testing
subtasks.description: Test calculator functionality across all major browsers and versions
subtasks.details: Test on Chrome (latest 2 versions), Firefox (latest 2 versions), Safari (latest 2 versions), Edge (latest 2 versions), and mobile browsers (iOS Safari, Chrome Android). Verify all features work correctly: button clicks, display updates, calculations, keyboard input. Document any browser-specific issues or inconsistencies

subtasks.title: Test Responsive Design on All Devices
subtasks.description: Verify calculator displays and functions correctly across all screen sizes and devices
subtasks.details: Test on mobile phones (320px-480px), tablets (768px-1024px), laptops (1024px-1440px), and desktop monitors (1440px+). Check portrait and landscape orientations. Verify button sizes are touch-friendly on mobile, layout adapts smoothly, text remains readable, no horizontal scrolling occurs. Use browser dev tools and real devices where available

subtasks.title: Verify Accessibility Compliance
subtasks.description: Ensure calculator meets WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards
subtasks.details: Run automated accessibility tests (axe DevTools, WAVE). Test keyboard navigation (Tab order, Enter/Space activation). Verify screen reader compatibility (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver). Check color contrast ratios (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text). Ensure all interactive elements have proper labels and ARIA attributes. Test with keyboard-only navigation

subtasks.title: Create Final Test Report
subtasks.description: Compile comprehensive test results and recommendations document
subtasks.details: Document all test results including: unit test coverage percentage and results, browser compatibility matrix, responsive design test outcomes, accessibility audit findings. List all issues found with severity levels (critical, major, minor). Include screenshots of any visual issues. Provide recommendations for fixes and future improvements. Create executive summary with go/no-go deployment recommendation

tasks.title: Deploy to Production
tasks.description: Deploy the calculator application to production environment
tasks.details: Run deployment script, verify all files uploaded correctly, test production URL, ensure HTTPS is working. Monitor for any errors in first 24 hours. Create release notes documenting features and known issues
tasks.testStrategy: Verify production deployment matches local version, test all functionality on live site, monitor error logs

subtasks.title: Execute deployment script and verify build
subtasks.description: Run the final build and deployment script to push the calculator application to the production environment
subtasks.details: Execute the deployment script created in task 44. Ensure all assets are properly minified, source maps are generated, and files are correctly copied to the dist/ folder. Verify the build process completes without errors and check that all necessary files (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) are included in the deployment package. Confirm HTTPS configuration is properly set up.

subtasks.title: Verify production deployment completeness
subtasks.description: Confirm all files have been successfully uploaded to the production server and are accessible
subtasks.details: Check that all files from the dist/ folder are properly uploaded to the production environment. Verify the production URL is accessible and returns the correct content. Ensure all assets (CSS, JavaScript) are loading correctly with proper MIME types. Confirm that the file structure matches the expected deployment configuration and that no files are missing.

subtasks.title: Test all calculator functionality on live site
subtasks.description: Perform comprehensive testing of all calculator features in the production environment
subtasks.details: Test all calculator operations including: basic arithmetic (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division), decimal number handling, clear functionality, consecutive operations, edge cases (division by zero, very large numbers). Verify the UI displays correctly across different browsers and devices. Ensure all buttons are responsive and the display updates properly. Compare functionality with the local development version to ensure parity.

subtasks.title: Monitor deployment and create release notes
subtasks.description: Set up monitoring for the first 24 hours and document the release
subtasks.details: Set up error monitoring and logging to track any issues in the first 24 hours after deployment. Monitor server logs, JavaScript console errors, and user feedback channels. Create comprehensive release notes documenting: implemented features (basic calculator operations, responsive design), known limitations, deployment date and version, any configuration changes. Document the production URL and update the README with the live site link.
